intro: Acidosasa lingchuanensis, commonly known as the Lingchuan acacia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is typically found in subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial shade. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
